There already ARE larger seats - First Class and Business Class. You pay more for them because you take up more space, and space is at a premium on an airplane. I'll admit, the airline seats these days are too crowded for anyone bigger than a 10-year-old or a midget to be truly comfortable. I have a co-worker who is 6'4", and even though he's not fat, it's really tough for him to squeeze into the seats because his knees hit the seat in front of him. So I'll agree... the seats are just too dang small for normal human beings to be comfortable. But to simply FIT in the seat... yeah, normal-sized people can fit in those seats just fine, even if they're not exactly comfortable. This is because I eat a healthy diet and exercise about 5 times per week. There's no mystery, no magic trick. If I didn't exercise, and if I lived on a steady diet of Supersize Value Meals at the local fast food slop house, I'd be rounder than a beach ball, and I wouldn't fit the economy class seats on airplanes either, no matter how short I am. OBESITY IS NOT A DISABILITY. In 99% of obese people, it's a sign of gluttony and sloth, two of those "deadly sins." So, getting back to the point... I'm short and small, and I fit airline economy class seats pretty well. HOWEVER, if I pay for my seat, I don't want someone's fat rolls or bulbous arms taking up even a fraction of an inch of the seat that I BOUGHT. My seat. My precious inches of space on that hideously cramped flight. Not yours. Not sharing. You buy your own. You don't get to use mine. I'm sorry, but we're not that good friends, dude. You want space to spread out, you buy it. Don't make me uncomfortable because you couldn't lay off the Big Macs. content: quote: Originally posted by 6486143: The simple solution is to install "fat azz" seats.....a couple of rows set aside for those handicapped folks who are over weight...disability is recognized everywhere else.. There already ARE larger seats - First Class and Business Class. You pay more for them because you take up more space, and space is at a premium on an airplane. I'll admit, the airline seats these days are too crowded for anyone bigger than a 10-year-old or a midget to be truly comfortable. I have a co-worker who is 6'4", and even though he's not fat, it's really tough for him to squeeze into the seats because his knees hit the seat in front of him. So I'll agree... the seats are just too dang small for normal human beings to be comfortable. But to simply FIT in the seat... yeah, normal-sized people can fit in those seats just fine, even if they're not exactly comfortable. I'm short - 5'1" - and I fit economy class seats as comfortably as anyone could, aside from children and midgets. I'm also not fat. This is because I eat a healthy diet and exercise about 5 times per week. There's no mystery, no magic trick. If I didn't exercise, and if I lived on a steady diet of Supersize Value Meals at the local fast food slop house, I'd be rounder than a beach ball, and I wouldn't fit the economy class seats on airplanes either, no matter how short I am. OBESITY IS NOT A DISABILITY. In 99% of obese people, it's a sign of gluttony and sloth, two of those "deadly sins." So, getting back to the point... I'm short and small, and I fit airline economy class seats pretty well. HOWEVER, if I pay for my seat, I don't want someone's fat rolls or bulbous arms taking up even a fraction of an inch of the seat that I BOUGHT. My seat. My precious inches of space on that hideously cramped flight. Not yours. Not sharing. You buy your own. You don't get to use mine. The worst thing is when some fatty thinks that BECAUSE I'm small, that gives him/her the right to use part of my space, just because it's physically possible. I'm sorry, but we're not that good friends, dude. You want space to spread out, you buy it. Don't make me uncomfortable because you couldn't lay off the Big Macs. Oh, here's a really sad thing I just saw... our hospital just bought another dozen wheelchairs... ALL OVERSIZED. The patients keep getting fatter and fatter, and they don't fit the regular wheelchairs. Pathetic.

content: Bravo, Whirled Peas! Very well said! I'm 5'3" and 115 lbs. It's quite cozy for ME in Cattle Class (aka Economy), especially on the international flights to which I'm doomed for the next few years, so I can only imagine how uncomfortable it is for someone of a more "average" height and weight to be forced to crumple him/herself into such a teensy space. To have to endure the fleshy spillage of Peter or Polly Porkbelly is expecting the tolerance only exhibited by saints, not mere mortals like the flying public. If I could take a train across the Atlantic, I would. I am so strongly in favor of high-speed rail systems and beefed-up rail transit and bus systems in lieu of flights and cars that words fail me. When I return Stateside, my travels will be by rail - room to stretch, walk, and time to look out the window and watch America passing by.
